citation.article-title: Comamonas Davis and Park 1962 gen. nov., nom. rev. emend., and Comamonas terrigena Hugh 1962 sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of the genus Comamonas nom. rev., gen. nov.
Comamonas (Co'ma.mo.nas. L.n. coma lock of hair; Gr.n. monas unit, monad; M.L. fem. n. Comamonas cell with a polar tuft of flagella)
Cells are straight or slightly curved, rod shaped, and 0.5 to 1 by 1 to 4 Î¼m.
The cells occur singly or in pairs and are motile by means of a tuft of polar flagella.
Good growth is obtained on media containing organic acids, amino acids, or peptone.
The G+C content of the DNA ranges from 64 to 66 mol%.

DNA-rRNA hybridization studies indicate (23) that Comamonas belongs in the same rRNA branch as P. acidovorans, P. testosteroni, P. delafieldii, P. facillis, P. palleronii, P. flava, and P. saccharophila (i.e., rRNA group III of Palleroni [51])
The type species is Comamonas terrigena
